intro: Miconia astrotricha, commonly known as the star-leaved miconia, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that often have a distinctive star-shaped pattern on the underside. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by bright orange to red berries. Miconia astrotricha is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. However, it is also considered an invasive species in some regions due to its competitive nature.
